articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: Russian forces were battling Ukrainian troops for a third day on Thursday after they smashed through the Russian border in the Kursk region, an audacious attack on the world's biggest nuclear power that has forced Moscow to call in reserves.
articles.title: Russia battles Ukrainian troops for a third day after major incursion

articles.author: Ruma Paul
articles.description: Bangladesh is set to get a new, interim government headed by Nobel Peace Prize-winning economist Muhammad Yunus on Thursday, after weeks of tumultuous student protests forced Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to resign and flee the South Asian country.
articles.title: Bangladesh awaits installation of interim government after weeks of strife

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The World Central Kitchen (WCK), a U.S.-based, non-governmental organisation, said on Thursday that a Palestinian staff member had been killed in Gaza.
articles.title: World Central Kitchen says Palestinian staff member killed in Gaza

articles.author: Gram Slattery, Alexandra Ulmer, Nathan Layne
articles.description: A little over two weeks ago, Donald Trump's presidential campaign had visions of an expansive national strategy that would result in a landslide victory in November.
articles.title: How the Harris surge scrambled Trump's battle plan

articles.author: Alexandra Schwarz-Goerlich
articles.description: A 19-year-old Austrian terrorism suspect had taken concrete steps in planning an attack on a Taylor Swift concert, with chemical substances found during a search of his residence, Austria's general director for public security said.
articles.title: Austria finds chemicals in house of suspected Taylor Swift concert attack plotter

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A heavy security presence across Britain and a "show of unity" by local communities prevented a repeat of the widespread rioting seen in recent days involving racist attacks targeting Muslims and migrants, London's police chief said on Thursday.
articles.title: UK rioters thwarted by 'show of unity' by communities, says police chief

articles.author: Renee Maltezou, Yomna Mohamed
articles.description: U.S. military forces have struck at targets in Houthi-controlled Yemen in the past 24 hours, destroying two drones, a Houthi ground control station, and three anti-ship cruise missiles, the U.S. Central Command (CENTCOM) said.
articles.title: U.S. strikes at Houthi targets in Yemen after claim of attack on destroyers

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Republican presdential candidate Donald Trump said on Thursday he planned to hold a 2 p.m. (1800 GMT) news conference at his residence in Palm Beach, Florida.
articles.title: Trump to hold  2 p.m./1800 GMT news conference in Florida -social media post

articles.author: Marta Di Donfrancesco
articles.description: The Italian parliament has approved a law to improve conditions in the country's overcrowded prisons amid a spike in suicides among inmates.
articles.title: Italy moves to improve jail conditions as inmate suicides surge

articles.author: Jeff Mason, Joseph Ax
articles.description: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris will campaign alongside her new running mate, Tim Walz, on Wednesday, holding events in battleground states Wisconsin and Michigan that will offer an early test of his Midwestern credentials.
articles.title: Harris and Walz to campaign in crucial Michigan and Wisconsin
